item.title: Leonard add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "At last,' Padma says with satisfaction, 'you've learned how to tell things really fast." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Leonard add a quote by Max Weber
item.description: "The purely emotional form of Pietism is, as Ritschl has pointed out, a religious dilettantism for the leisure class." -- Max Weber

item.title: Leonard add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Billy took off his tri-focals and his coat and his necktie and his shoes, and he closed the venetian blinds and then the drapes, and he lay down on the outside of the coverlet. But sleep would not come. Tears came instead. Billy turned on the Magic Fingers, and he was jiggled as he wept." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Leonard add a quote by Immanuel Kant
item.description: "How then is perfection to be sought? Wherein lies our hope? In education, and in nothing else." -- Immanuel Kant

item.title: Leonard add a quote by Jacques Lacan
item.description: "The reason we go to poetry is not for wisdom, but for the dismantling of wisdom" -- Jacques Lacan

item.title: Leonard add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "This book is intended for calm readers." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Leonard add a quote by Friedrich Schlegel
item.description: "philosophy of art usually lacks one of two things: either the philosophy or the art" -- Friedrich Schlegel

item.title: Leonard add a quote by Martin Jay
item.description: "It was not surprising that after the war Dostoevsky was linked to Kierkegaard as a prophet of social resignation." -- Martin Jay

item.title: Leonard add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Maybe even more important than the D.B.P. [Divine Brotherhood of Pythagoras], &#8734;-wise is the protomystic Parmenides of Elea (c.515-? BCE), not only because of his distinction between the 'Way of Truth' and 'Way of Seeing' framed the terms of Greek metaphysics and (again) influenced Plato, but because Parmenides' #1 student and defender was the aforementioned Zeno, the most fiendishly clever and upsetting philosopher ever (who can be seen actually kicking Socrates' ass, argumentatively speaking, in Plato's <i>Parmenides</i>)." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Leonard add a quote by Thomas Brockelman
item.description: "Modernity could be identified with the gradual disappearance of <i>ritual</i>, of those kind of communal bonds founded upon a <i>symbolically shared</i> sense of guilt." -- Thomas Brockelman

item.title: Leonard add a quote by Edward R. Tufte
item.description: "Design cannot rescue failed content." -- Edward R. Tufte

item.title: Leonard add a quote by Julie Dirksen
item.description: "I wince now to think of when I was a new teacher, and said things like "This is really important stuff" or "You'll be really glad you know this stuff later on." -- Julie Dirksen

item.title: Leonard add a quote by Diana Laurillard
item.description: "Research and development projects on educational media pay quantities of hard cash for development, lip-service to evaluation, and no attention to implementation." -- Diana Laurillard

item.title: Leonard add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Leonard add a quote by Ring Lardner
Leonard add a quote by Dieter Rams
item.description: "The composition of these rooms represents the basic intention behind my design: simplicity, essentiality and openness." -- Dieter Rams
